servinfo.title: Cylinder Head Cover Removal and Installation

s1.ptxt: Disconnect negative cable at battery.
Disconnect MAF sensor coupler (1).
Remove air cleaner case (2).
Remove cylinder head upper cover.
Disconnect ignition coil couplers (1).
Remove ignition coil assemblies (2) with high-tension cord (3).
Remove wire harness clamp from cylinder head cover.
Remove oil level gauge (1).
Disconnect PCV hose (2) from PCV valve (3) and disconnect breather hose (4) from cylinder head cover.
Remove cylinder head cover mounting bolts in such order as indicated in the figure.
Remove cylinder head cover (1) with cylinder head cover gasket (2) and spark plug hole gasket (3).
Install new spark plug hole gaskets (1) and new cylinder head cover gasket (2) to cylinder head cover (3) as shown in the figure.
Remove oil, old sealant, and dust from sealing surfaces on cylinder head and cover. After cleaning, apply sealant “A” to the following point.

item.ptxt: Cylinder head cover gasket (1) sealing surface area (2) as shown.
Timing chain cover (1) and cylinder head (2) mating surface as shown.

s1.ptxt: Install cylinder head cover to cylinder head.

attention3.ptxt: When installing cylinder head cover, use care so that cylinder head cover gasket or spark plug hole gaskets will not get out of place or fall off.

s1.ptxt: Tightening bolts in such order as indicated in the figure a little at a time till they are tightened to specified torque.
Connect PCV hose (2) to PCV valve (3).
Connect breather hose (4).
Install oil level gauge (1).
Install wire harness clamp to cylinder head cover.
Install ignition coil assemblies with high-tension cord.
Connect ignition coil couplers and clamp harness securely.
Install cylinder head upper cover.
Connect negative cable at battery.
